title: Die Veneris, 27‚Å∞ Iunii, 1645. It is this day ordered by the Commons assembled in Parliament, that in regard many hundreds of the common souldiers lately taken prisoners by Sir Thomas Fairfax, have very cheerfully listed themselves for the service of the Parliament, against those bloudy and barbarous rebels of Ireland ...
author: England and Wales. Parliament. House of Commons.
notes: Signed: H. Elsynge, Cler. Parl. D. Com.
Calls for contributions "towards the relief and transportation" of these soldiers.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
